intro: Eriospermum gracillimum, commonly known as the slender eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
